data.fullContent: Nuclear power is the use of controlled nuclear fission to generate heat, which is then used to generate electricity. Nuclear power is clean and safe, because it does not produce solid wastes, and it does not release air emissions - unlike fossil fuel power plants. It is also reliable and has a proven safety record. In the United States, approximately 20% of all electricity comes from nuclear energy. Some of the largest nuclear plants in the country are located on the shores of Lake Michigan, along the Mississippi River, and near Florida's Gulf coast. If you want to know how a nuclear power plant works, you will need to know the basics of nuclear science. These will be explained in the next section.

q1.translation: 核能是利用受控的核裂变产生热量，然后用热量发电。核能是清洁和安全的，因为它不产生固体废物，也不排放空气——不像化石燃料发电厂。它也很可靠，有可靠的安全记录。

options.sentence: Nuclear power is the use of nuclear fission to generate electricity.
